titleStmt.title: Letter from H. M. Schieffelin to William H. Seward, January 25, 1867

bibl.title: Letter from H. M. Schieffelin to William H. Seward
Notes from Liberian Legation In U.S. to Department of State, 1862-1898 T807

correspAction.roleName: Vice Consul of Liberia for New York

div1.p:
Legation of Liberia,
Yonkers, N.Y. Jany 11th, 1867

I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your note of the 19th instant informing me that my request for the aid of one of the cruisers of the United States, on the coast of Africa for the Government of Liberia would received the earliest consideration; and also that of 21st instant, stating that a copy of my note has been transmitted, for the information of Rear Admiral Goldsborough, commanding the European Squadron, within whose limits Liberia is situated; and I desire to tender herein thanks for the prompt attention accorded.

I have the honor to be, with the highest consideration, Sir, your most obedient Servant
H. M. Schieffelin
div1.fw:
To Honble William H Seward
Secretary of State
Washington D.C.
